org.assistments.service

Interface AccountService

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    AccountServiceImpl

    public interface AccountService
    This interface contains the operations on ASSISTments user account and manages the association between ASSISTments user and Partner user.
    Author:
    szhao

    • Method Detail

      • transferUser

        ReferenceTokenPair transferUser(User user,
                              java.lang.String schoolRef,
                              java.lang.String partnerExternalRef,
                              java.lang.String partnerAccessToken,
                              java.lang.String note)
                                throws TransferUserException
        Transfer the user from Partner to ASSISTments. First it checks if partnerExternalRef already exists. If it doesn't, a new user will be created inside ASSISTments, and system will assign this user to a certain school. Store the association between new ASSISTments user and Partner user into database. If it does exist, external reference and access token will be fetched from database.
        Parameters:
        user - -- It contains information about this user, like user type, first name, last name ...
        schoolRef - -- External reference for a certain school. This comes from ASSISTments.
        partnerExternalRef - -- Partner external reference for this user. This comes from Partner.
        partnerAccessToken - -- Partner access token for this user. This comes from Partner.
        note - -- To keep extra information
        Returns:
        ReferenceTokenPair object. It contains external reference and access token for this user.
        Throws:
        TransferUserException

      • createUser

        ReferenceTokenPair createUser(User user,
                            java.lang.String partnerExternalRef,
                            java.lang.String partnerAccessToken,
                            java.lang.String note)
                              throws java.lang.Exception
        Create a new user inside ASSISTments. Store the association between new user and Partner user into database.
        Parameters:
        user - -- It contains information about this user, like user type, first name, last name ...
        partnerExternalRef - -- Partner external reference for this user. This comes from Partner.
        partnerAccessToken - -- Partner access token for this user. This comes from Partner.
        note - -- To keep extra information
        Returns:
        ReferenceTokenPair object. It contains external reference and access token for this user.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • createAccessToken

        java.lang.String createAccessToken(java.lang.String userRef)
                                   throws java.lang.Exception
        Only create a new access token for a user.
        Parameters:
        userRef - -- External reference for the user. It comes from ASSISTments.
        Returns:
        access token for this user
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - -- if this user already has access token, an exception will be thrown out.

      • isEmailInUse

        boolean isEmailInUse(java.lang.String email)
        Check if there is ASSISTments account associated with this email.
        Parameters:
        email - -- email address
        Returns:
        true -- if email already exists

      • isExternalUserExists

        boolean isExternalUserExists(java.lang.String partnerExternalRef)
        Check if Partner user already exists based on partner_external_reference
        Parameters:
        partnerExternalRef - -- partner external reference for this user from Partner.
        Returns:
        true -- if the user already exists.

      • find

        java.util.List<PartnerToAssistments> find(PartnerToAssistments.ColumnNames cn,
                                        java.lang.String value)
                                          throws ReferenceNotFoundException
        Find a certain external user based on column name and value
        Parameters:
        cn - -- column name. It comes from table partner_to_assistments_links (partner_external_references)
        value - -- value for the column
        Returns:
        a list of external users
        Throws:
        ReferenceNotFoundException - -- If nothing is found, this exception will be thrown out.

      • update

        void update(PartnerToAssistments pta)
        Update table for this user based on user external reference outside and inside ASSISTments I assume external_reference and partner_external_reference shouldn't change over the time. So please be aware that this method is intended to update assistments_access_token, partner_access_token and note
        Parameters:
        pta - -- an object represents external user

      • getUserProfile

        User getUserProfile(java.lang.String externalRef)
        Get user profile information from ASSISTments
        Parameters:
        externalRef - -- Identifier for this user from ASSISTments
        Returns:
        User object -- It contains user information.
